Case Study
Disney Magic Wheels

Assignment

“Develop a unique digital experience (mobile or cross-channel) of Instant Digital Loyalty that can run in any supermarket and it is based on movies of the Disney franchise.”


Blendert.

Best of Both Worlds

Wesley Cheung
Prototyper
Ruben Melchers
Concept &
User Research
Sylvana Woelders
Visual Design
Machiel van der Giessen
Interaction Design

Target Audience

Children between the 6 and 12 years old

Research

Research

We had interviews with superusers in Rotterdam about there workfields. We interviewd Notificare about personal push notifications and YipYip about there experience with working in this target audience.

Probe

To reach our target group we made a probe wich we send to the parents. We asked them to ask some questions to there children and to let them draw a picture about there favorite thing to do in the supermarket.

Desk Research

Ofcourse we also did desk research. This included a social media research, cognitive development of children between 6 and 12, competition research and research on Disney itself.

Read our research report

Concepts

Woody's World

In Woody’s World you can create your own AR Disney world. Children can collect cards at the supermarket to collect there favorite Toy Story characters.

Disney Kart

Disney Kart is a kart game where children can collect pieces for there kart and race against there friends. The cards can be collected at the nearest supermarket.

Mystery Solver

Mystery Solver is a game in the supermarket where you can solve a mystery with your favorite Disney character.

Read the whole concept report
With Icemobile we decided to merge two concepts with eachother. The game of Disney Kart and the storytelling element of Mistery Solver.

We focus on two main elements of these two concepts. Together we made one concept where children can play the game and collect cards at the supermarket.

Wireframes

Wireframes

After a sketch session with the team we made the digital wireframes to test them. We made them in Sketch and made them clickable with Invision. After a quick test with other teams we tweaked the wireframes before we started with the visual designs.

Test our wireframes

Visual Design

The interface of our app and game had to be playfull. Our target audience doen’t care about fancy design and just want to have a great experience with there favorite Disney characters.

Primary Colors

Typography

The font choise is based on the playfull look of the font. Its a fun font and still readable. We used this for buttons, and plain text.

Gradients

Francois one

XyYzZ

Prototyping

Because our team is a mix of CMD and MT students we were able to create a high definition prototype. We designed the app and game in Sketch and developed them in Unity.

SKETCH

UNITY

Design

The design is made in Sketch app. Before we made them in Unity we discussed our screens with the client. Together we talked about the flow and UI of our design. After a few tweaks we made the designs clickable in Unity.

Development

We developed our app and game in Unity. We choose Unity because we already knew the coding language and already had some knowledge about this tool. Also Unity is a very visual tool were you can see the results immediately.

User Testing

Ofcourse we had to test our protoype with the target audience. Because they are very young we weren’t able to test it in the wireframe phase. Simple because these children would not understand what a wireframe is and don’t know where they could click. Therefore we choose to test our prototype when most of the design was finished and working.

Results
